question: What percent of all the household wealth in the United States does the top 0.1% (that is, one in one thousand people) own?
options: Less than 10%
Between 10% and 25%
Between 25% and 40%
Between 40% and 55%
More than 55%

question: How much has the unemployment rate increased or decreased between January 2009, when President Obama took office, and March 2016?
options: Unemployment increased by more than 5 percentage points
Unemployment increased by 2-5 percentage point
Unemployment stayed within 2 percentage points
Unemployment decreased by 2-5 percentage point
Unemployment decreased by more than 5 percentage points

question: In 2008, the year before President Obama took office, it was estimated that just under 12 million unauthorized immigrants were living in the United States. How has this number changed over the course of Obama’s administration?
options: Increased substantially (by 2 million or more)
Increased somewhat (by fewer than 2 million)
Stayed roughly the same
Decreased somewhat (by fewer than 2 million)
Decreased substantially (by more than 2 million)

question: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump has proposed cutting foreign aid spending as a means of funding social security. What percentage of the U.S. federal budget each year goes to foreign aid (rounded to the nearest integer)?
options: 21% or more

question: At the end of 2013, just before Obamacare went into effect, over 17% of American adults were uninsured. What percent of American adults were uninsured at the end of 2015?
options: The percent of uninsured is now more than 25%
The percent of uninsured is now between 20% and 25%
The percent of uninsured is now between 15% and 20%
The percent of uninsured is now between 10% and 15%
The percent of uninsured is now less than 10%

question: With almost five million refugees, the Syrian refugee crisis has been described as the worst in a generation or more. What fraction has come to the United States?
options: 30% or more
Less than 5%

question: Over the past 10 years, how has the number of police officers killed in the line of duty (as the result of criminal acts) changed, according to the FBI?
options: 30+ more police officers killed per year
15-30 more police officers killed per year
1-15 more police officers killed per year
1-15 fewer police officers killed per year
15+ fewer police officers killed per year

question: How much higher was mean global temperature in 2015, relative to its 20th century average?
options: Less than 1 degree C
1-2 degrees C
2-3 degrees C
3-4 degrees C
More than 4 degrees C

question: When former President Obama took office in 2009, the Department of Homeland Security estimates there were almost 12 million unauthorized immigrants living in the United States.  How did this number change during his two terms in office?
options: Decreased a lot (by 2 million or more).
Decreased somewhat (by more than 1 million, but fewer than 2 million).
Remained more or less the same (within 1 million).
Increased somewhat (by more than 1 million, but fewer than 2 million).
Increased a lot (by 2 million or more).

question: When former President Obama took office in 2009, the Department of Homeland Security estimates there were almost 12 million unauthorized immigrants living in the United States.  How did this number change during his two terms in office?
options: Decreased a lot (by 2 million or more).
Decreased somewhat (by more than 1 million, but fewer than 2 million).
Remained more or less the same (within 1 million).
Increased somewhat (by more than 1 million, but fewer than 2 million).
Increased a lot (by 2 million or more).

question: According to the Department of Labor, what happened to the unemployment rate between January 2009, when former President Obama took office, and the election of President Trump in November 2016?
options: Unemployment increased by more than 5 percentage points.
Unemployment increased by 2-5 percentage points.
Unemployment remained within 2 percentage points of its initial level.
Unemployment decreased by 2-5 percentage points.
Unemployment decreased by more than 5 percentage points.

question: In February 2018, President Trump told the CPAC conference “we're having tremendous plans coming out now, health care plans, at a fraction of the cost that are much better than Obamacare.” What has happened to the percentage of American adults without health insurance since President Trump took office?
options: It has decreased three percentage points or more - meaning, a much larger share of American adults have health insurance now.
It has decreased between one and three percentage points - meaning, a somewhat larger share of American adults have health insurance now.
It has changed less than one percentage point in either direction - meaning, about the same share of American adults have health insurance now.
It has increased between one and three percentage points - meaning, a somewhat smaller share of American adults have health insurance now.
It has increased more than three percentage points - meaning, a much smaller share of American adults have health insurance now.

question: On November 8th, 2016, when Donald Trump was elected President, the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the best-known measure of stock market performance, stood at 19,827. Six months after taking office, how has the Dow Jones changed?
options: The Dow Jones has decreased a lot (more than 15%)
The Dow Jones has decreased somewhat (more than 5% but less than 15%)
The Dow Jones hasn?t changed much (within 5% of where it started)
The Dow Jones has increased somewhat (more than 5% but less than 15%)
The Dow Jones has increased a lot (more than 15%)

question: In the final month of his presidency, how did former President Barack Obama's approval rating compare with the approval ratings of former President Ronald Reagan and former President George W. Bush at the same point in their presidencies?
options: Obama’s approval rating was lower than Reagan’s and lower than Bush’s
Obama’s approval rating was lower than Reagan’s and similar (within 5%) to Bush’s
Obama’s approval rating was lower than Reagan’s and higher than Bush’s
Obama’s approval rating was similar (within 5%) to Reagan’s and higher than Bush’s
Obama’s approval rating was higher than Reagan’s and higher than Bush’s

question: President Obama once claimed that climate change “will define the contours of this century,” while his successor, President Trump, has called it a “hoax.” According to the National Oceanographic and Atmospheric Administration or NOAA, how did the average global temperature last year (2017) compare to its average over the 20th century?
options: The temperature last year was about the same (within half a degree Fahrenheit)
The temperature last year was a little higher (between half and 1 degree F warmer)
The temperature last year was somewhat higher (between 1 and 1.5 degrees F warmer)
The temperature last year was significantly higher (between 1.5 and 2 degrees F warmer)
The temperature last year was much higher (more than 2 degrees F warmer)

question: During President Obama?s first year in office, Congress passed more bills (124) than it did during President GW Bush?s first year (118), but fewer than it did during President Clinton?s first year (209). President Trump campaigned on the promise that “nobody knows the system better than me, which is why I alone can fix it.” How did President Trump?s first year compare?
options: Congress passed more than 250 bills during President Trump’s first year
Congress passed between 200 and 250 bills during President Trump’s first year
Congress passed between 150 and 200 bills during President Trump’s first year
Congress passed between 100 and 150 bills during President Trump’s first year
Congress passed fewer than 100 bills during President Trump’s first year

question: Under President Obama, the consumer confidence index rose from 37.4 in January 2009, when he first took office, to 113.3 in January 2017, when he left it. How has consumer confidence changed under President Trump?
options: It is lower than when President Obama took office – that is, lower than 37.4.
It is about the same as when President Obama took office – that is, about 37.4.
It is higher than when President Obama took office, but lower than when he left it – that is, higher than 37.4 but lower than 113.3.
It is about the same as when President Obama left office – that is, about 113.3.
It is higher than when President Obama left office – that is, higher than 113.3.
